model_answer: B: She first acknowledges her country’s strong record in women’s chess and notes recent improvements on the open/men’s side. She then highlights how teamwork and past results encourage youth to devote themselves, grows passionate about promoting women’s chess, and shares that top players’ stories inspire children—capping it with her own motivating early draw against a top grandmaster. Tournament visuals of focused young players and her animated gestures mirror this build in commitment and inspiration.

The trajectory outlined by the interviewee is A: She defends the knockout system and vows to reclaim the title at any cost. Later she insists chess is her entire life and concludes by committing to a single, ultimate goal. This is evident from her initial defense of the knockout system, her declaration of chess as her entire life, and her commitment to achieving a single, ultimate goal. As the interview progresses, she does not deviate from this trajectory.
